str:CategoryScheme.com:Name: Economic concepts
str:CategoryScheme.com:Description: This category scheme is used for the Data Explorer of the ECB SDW mobile application. It is used for grouping all dataflows following the top-level categories displayed on the SDW portal.

str:Category.com:Name: Monetary operations
str:Category.com:Description: This section shows the key ECB interest rates for the euro area as well as statistics on minimum reserves and liquidity factors and conditions.

str:Category.com:Name: Prices, output, demand and labour market
str:Category.com:Description: HICP, national accounts, labour market and survey indicator data.

str:Category.com:Name: Monetary and financial statistics
str:Category.com:Description: Statistics regarding monetary financial institutions (MFIs), investment funds, financial stability and financial markets, and payments within the euro area. This includes the monetary aggregates, their counterparts and other monetary stocks and flows statistics, including minimum reserve and liquidity statistics and all seasonally adjusted statistics; statistics on securities issues (including quoted shares), investment funds and other financial intermediaries, statistics on yields and interest rates, banking statistics, financial market statistics, financial integration indicators, and STEP statistics.

str:Category.com:Name: Euro area accounts
str:Category.com:Description: These statistics present balance sheets (stocks) and financial and non-financial flows of the different sectors of the euro area, and between these sectors and the rest of the world. Selected items for other economic areas are also included.

str:Category.com:Name: Government finance
str:Category.com:Description: These statistics show the general government deficit, debt and deficit-debt adjustment.

str:Category.com:Name: External transactions and positions
str:Category.com:Description: This section provides data on balance of payments (b.o.p.) statistics, euro area external trade in goods, aggregated data on the international investment position (i.i.p.) and the outstanding amounts of the Eurosystem's international reserves The euro area b.o.p. is compiled by the ECB whereas the main source for trade data is the European Commission (Eurostat).

str:Category.com:Name: Exchange rates
str:Category.com:Description: This section shows the euro foreign exchange reference rates that are based on the regular daily concertation procedure between central banks within and outside the European System of Central Banks, which normally takes place at 2.15 p.m. ECB time (CET). It also shows the nominal effective exchange rates of the euro as calculated by the ECB.

str:Category.com:Name: Payments and securities trading, clearing, settlement
str:Category.com:Description: Covers statistics of: payment instructions processed by TARGET and other selected interbank fund transfer systems, domestic payments in each RTGS system participating in or connected to TARGET, and statistics on cross-border payments. All data are presented both by volume and by value of transactions.

str:Category.com:Name: Real Time Database (research database)
str:Category.com:Description: This is an experimental dataset constructed to provide historical vintages of data published in the Monthly Bulletin since January 2001.

str:CategoryScheme.com:Name: Predefined data baskets
str:CategoryScheme.com:Description: The list of predefined data baskets used by the ECB statistical tablet app

str:Category.com:Name: Monetary operations
str:Category.com:Description: This section shows the key ECB interest rates for the euro area as well as statistics on minimum reserves and liquidity factors and conditions.
